artist: Artist: Claes Janz. Visscher II; Artist: after Maarten de Vos
creditline: Gift of James A. Bergquist, Boston, in honor of Rachel McGarry
description: kneeling woman wearing a crown at center with a bird above her head; Jesus in cloud, holding an open book, with winged putti heads at top center; other women wearing crowns surround kneeling woman; building in background at center; text at bottom
inscription: In plate, at bottom: M. de Vos invent.  /  Catica.6.1.  /  ICVisscher  Excu.  /  6
text: This is the final image in a series of six treating the Song of Soloman. Here an allegorical figure, an elaborately dressed woman representing Faith, kneels on the ground and looks up to see Jesus in the heavens. He holds an open a book that says, "Vox Sponsi -- Verbum Vitae" (The voice of the bride --  The word of life). Blood gushes from a wound in his side, hits the book, and flows down throughthe dove of the Holy Spirit, finally landing on the kneeling woman. In effect, she has become his bride. Around her are eight crowned women, some with unguent jars,  one holding firewood, one an urn, and another a basket filled with bones.
title: Plate 6, from "The Song of Solomon"
